Class EditUserProfileView

java.lang.Object
musicApp.views.View
musicApp.views.EditUserProfileView
public class EditUserProfileView extends View
The Playlist edit view. This is a popup window that allows the user to create or edit a playlist.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    EditUserProfileView.EditUserProfileViewListener
    Listener interface for handling events in the EditPlaylistView.

    • populateFields

      public void populateFields(String userName, String imagePath, String musicPath)
      Populate the fields with the provided user name, image path, and music path.
      Parameters:
      userName - The user name to set in the text field.
      imagePath - The path to the user image.
      musicPath - The path to the music folder.

    • initLanguageChoice

      private void initLanguageChoice()

    • refreshTranslation

      protected void refreshTranslation()
      Refresh the translation for the UI elements. This method updates the text of various labels and buttons based on the current language settings.
      Overrides:
      refreshTranslation in class View

    • close

      public void close()
      Close the stage. This method is called to close the EditUserProfileView when the user is done editing.

    • initButtons

      private void initButtons()
      Sets up the controls for the PlaylistEditView. This method creates the text field, buttons, and labels used in the view.

    • handleBrowseMusicFolder

      private void handleBrowseMusicFolder()
      Handle when the browse button is pressed

    • handleChooseImage

      private void handleChooseImage()
      Handles the action when the user selects an image for the playlist. This method opens a file chooser dialog to select an image file.

    • getCrossfadeLabelString

      public String getCrossfadeLabelString(double crossfadeDuration)
      Get the crossfade label string. This method formats the crossfade duration to a string with one decimal place and appends the unit "seconds".
      Parameters:
      crossfadeDuration - The crossfade duration in seconds.
      Returns:
      The formatted crossfade label string.
